person:biography.personal-details:content: Dr. Niranjan Koirala, Ph.D. (2016) in biochemistry (Biochemical engineering), Sun Moon University, Republic of Korea. He has completed assignments as a Postdoctoral research fellow (Microbial-Industrial biotechnology), Universidad Nacional Autonoma de Mexico (QS global world rank-103), under the supervision of Professor Sergio Sanchez (2018) and ongoing Postdoctoral research fellow at the University of Macau (QS global world rank-387), Macau SAR-China at the faculty of science and technology (Environmental-Industrial biotechnology). His interest is in the field of industrial biotechnology. Technically he has skills in genome mining, gene isolation using PCR, cloning and protein purification, metabolic engineering, metabolic co-factor channeling, synthesis using enzyme biocatalysis, bioprocess-fermentation technology, phytochemicals, modifications and testing biological activities, methanogenesis optimization, biogas from waste, UASB reactor, HPLC, ESI-MS, GC-MS, and NMR. His research works collaborate with the Mexican, Vietnamese, Chinese, Indian, Nepalese and Korean groups to date and its expanding more. He likes to work on research projects producing high-quality publications and patents. Research works he has completed to date have been cited by the International research community (Citation: 350; h-index: 10; i10-index: 11, as indexed by Google Scholar). His works have been published in Internationally reputed indexed journals like Journal of Biotechnology, Journal of Industrial Microbiology and Biotechnology, Enzyme and Microbial Technology, World Journal of Microbiology and Biotechnology, Antonie Van Leeuwenhoek, Applied Biochemistry and Biotechnology to name a few selected ones. Moreover, most of the research works he carried out in the area of secondary metabolites during his Ph.D. study have been granted patent rights by Korean Intellectual Patents Office, Korea. He has been awarded the best poster presentation award and best oral presentation award in the international conferences; Nepal Bidhya Bhushan “A” medal from the honorable President of Nepal; Dean’s Choice award by Sun Moon University, South Korea; BRICPL Young Scientist award by Biologix Research and Innovation Center, India; Shreepati Koirala Memorial Academic Award; Certificate of appreciation by Koirala Welfare Society-Kaski, Nepal to name a few selected ones. He is a member of the American Society for Microbiology, International Chemical Biology Society and a lifetime member of the Biotechnology Society of Nepal. Professionally, Dr. Koirala has experience in supervising undergraduate and graduate students of biotechnology and biochemistry majors. He is actively serving in several international journals as an editorial board member and reviewer. Further, he has been invited and participated in several national and international conferences and workshops in the capacity of organizing committee members or a speaker.

common:organization.common:name: Pokhara University, Nobel College of Health Sciences

work:title.common:title: Assessing acceptor substrate promiscuity of YjiC-mediated glycosylation toward flavonoids
Enzymatic synthesis of epothilone A glycosides
Glucosylation of isoflavonoids in engineered Escherichia coli
